text_raw:
3. The Principal Order is amended by inserting after Article 51 the 

following: 

“Tenure of Director 

51A A person who holds the position of director of a regional 
assembly may seek to have his or her tenure period extended where 
written notification is given by the director to the Cathaoirleach of the 
regional assembly concerned. 

51B A director seeking to have his or her tenure period extended 
under article 51A shall provide written notification of this a minimum of 
3 months in advance of the expiration date of his or her contract. 

51C A written notification provided by a director 

the 
Cathaoirleach of a regional assembly prior to this amendment coming 
into operation shall be deemed as valid for the purpose of Article 51B. 

to 

51D On receipt of notification the Cathaoirleach of the regional 

assembly concerned shall— 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th October, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [486] 3 

(a) 

inform the members of the regional assembly of it at the 
next meeting of that regional assembly, and 

(b) 

transmit a copy of it to the Minister and to the chief 
executive of the Public Appointments Service. 

51E A regional assembly may, with the approval of the Minister, 
extend the contract of employment of a director subject to such terms and 
conditions as may be specified by the Minister with the consent of the 
Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery 
and Reform. 

51F In no case shall the tenure period of a director’s contract be 

extended so as to exceed 10 years’ service in total. 

51G In cases where notification is not provided under Articles 51A 
to 51D then a director’s employment shall cease with effect from the 
expiration date of his or her contract of employment.” 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 4 October 2023 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 
 Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform hereby consents to the Local Government Act 1991 (Regional 
Assemblies) (Establishment) (Amendment) Order 2023. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the 
Minister for Public Expenditure, National 
 Development Plan Delivery and Reform, 

28 September, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Local Government Act 1991 (Regional Assemblies) 
(Establishment) Order 2014. 

This Order provides clarification on the provision for extension of a director’s 
contract of employment by a regional assembly and sets a maximum period of 
tenure of 10 years.
